description: Seems pretty inclusive. Handy to have on a workstation.

'Information will always be presented in the least useful units of measure; speed will always be given as Furlongs per Fortnight'
FpF to meters per second, no sweat! They're all here. Never blow an obscure conversion again!
summary: At Last - an answer to the Engineer's Corollary to Murphy's Law:

description: As this is so extensive, there are units you may not even know of, so check carefully the unit type selected

I have been using this tonight for my College Chemistry course and I downloaded the software. Upon opening it I was able to easily use the conversion software in conjunction with my calculator. Thanks so much and please continue to work/update this.


A recommended improvement - 
I would like to be able to perform math and exponents in the area where I submit my numbers to be converted so I don't have to calculate it beforehand. Unless maybe this is a function and I haven't figured it out yet.
Useful but check the first time you use a new conversion
Works...anything can get better...I like it.
I just installed it on a new laptop as it is so useful - saves looking up conversions online!
It doesn't covert Fahrenheit to Celsius degrees correctly, and the options are confusing. Looking for another converter option.

I use this often when I want to convert F to C for cooking recipies.

It would be great to have some favourites or frequently used conversions functionality, or maybe a historical record or start the application with the last used conversion.

Another feature that would be helpful is a swap button, like they have on some currency conversion websites, that would switch back and forth between the two units selected.
Rechnet so gut wie alle Einheiten um, Debian
Schlicht, aber alles dabei, was man braucht.
comme dans le titre pas de conversion Cc ou CC ( cuillère a soupe ) en gramme , unité en cuisine ..
summary: pas de conversion Cc ( cuillère a café) en gramme
